title: (x) 'Field Notes' geometric sans on notebook - Futura {Marten Fischer}
content:
I think this is the same font/weight/spacing combo used on a lot of US military documentation during WW2 but it may be slightly different.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fieldnotes.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211516/http:/typophile.com/files/fieldnotes.jpg) | 41.62 KB |

 [‹ (x) Kongekabale compressed sans on DVD cover - Univers UltCond {Richard Hards}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211516/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36547 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Basic square "Rockstar Games" - custom drawn {Ray Larabie} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211516/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36369 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sho

comments.content: Sorry! My mistake. It’s not Futura but it could be [Limerick](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211516/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/limerick/)...

I think you were right [the first time](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211516/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/futura_std_bold_ot/?sample_text=FIELD%20NOTES&sample_size=36), Marten. Limerick is a pretty rare knockoff of Futura. Highly unlikely.
You’re right, Stephen! I was fooled by the (misused?) quotation mark (’). I thought it was an apostrophe (’) and that didn’t match the one in Futura...
Futura Bold it is, much obliged to both of you.
